children.text: The construction of this area appears to be different from the construction documents we were provided.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 2.03 Setting out the site states that
‘A building set out is defective where the set out has failed to comply with the requirements of the approved drawings’
, and clause 2.06 Building dimensions states that

‘Departures from the documented set out for habitable rooms and areas, such as bedrooms, dining rooms, lounge and living rooms, family rooms, studies, halls, entries and stairways are defects if they exceed L/100 or 5 mm, whichever is the greater, where L is the documented dimension’ .
As this discrepancy is greater than the maximum allowable dimensions stated above, this area must be rectified/reconstructed in accordance with the contract documents.
